clinical_study.brief_title: Arginine Therapy for Sickle Cell Disease Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2 Randomized Control Trial of Arginine Therapy for Pediatric Sickle Cell Disease Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine whether giving extra arginine, a simple amino acid, to patients with sickle cell disease seeking treatment for a pain crisis (vaso-occlusive painful events (VOE) will decrease pain scores, decrease the need for pain medications or decrease length of hospital stay or emergency department visit. Funding Source - FDA OOPD.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of IV L-arginine hydrochloride therapy in children with sickle cell disease (SCD) and vaso-occlusive pain events (VOE). Specifically, the impact on total opioid use (mg/kg) over the duration of their emergency department (ED) visit and hospital stay will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Post study drug delivery (Up to 8 hours)
primary_outcome.description: The total amount of parenteral opioids used by participants measured in mg/kg. The total is calculated after study drug delivery for participants in the emergency department (ED) and during hospital stay.

secondary_outcome.description: The total number of hours spent in the hospital from study drug delivery to time of discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to vaso-occlusive pain event (VOE) resolution in emergency department
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post study drug delivery (Up to 8 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of hours between study drug delivery and the last parenteral opioid.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to vaso-occlusive pain event (VOE) resolution in hospital
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post study drug delivery (Up to 8 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of hours between study drug delivery and time of last parenteral opioid use, pain relief improved to tolerate oral pain medications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Time of discharge (Up to 7 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain associated with VOE will be measured on a scale of 0-10, with the ends representing the extreme limits of "no-pain" (0) and "worst pain" (10).
Total hours from time of ED triage to ED discharge or hospital admission.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post emergency department admission (Up to 8 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants discharged from ED without a hospital ward admission.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post study drug delivery (Up to 8 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Total opioid dose in mg/kg in the first 8 hours after study drug delivery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of study drug doses
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of study drug doses given throughout the study period.
Number of participants who develop acute chest syndrome (not diagnosed priort to study drug delivery) throughout the study period.
Number of participants requiring a blood transfusion throughout the study period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Discharge from emergency department (ED) (Up to 8 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Average oxygen saturation level of participants at time of ED discharge.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital admission (Up to 4 hours), Hospital discharge (Up to 7 days)
secondary_outcome.description: The difference in oxygen saturation levels from hospital admission to discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of return visits to emergency department (ED) within 72 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Number of ED visits from patients who have been discharged within the previous 72 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hospital re-admissions within 72 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients readmitted to the hospital within 72 hours of discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of return visits to emergency department (ED) within 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of ED visits from patients who have been discharged within the previous 30 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hospital re-admissions with 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients readmitted to the hospital within 30 days of discharge.

arm_group.description: Participants will be randomized to receive an intravenous (IV) infusion of L-arginine (100 mg/kg) three times a day until time of discharge from the emergency department (ED) or hospital.

Participants will be randomized to receive an intravenous (IV) infusion of one-time loading dose of L-arginine (200 mg/kg) followed by standard dose (100 mg/kg) three times a day until time of discharge from the emergency department (ED) or hospital.
Participants will be randomized to receive an intravenous (IV) infusion of placebo (normal saline 1-2 ml/kg) three times a day until time of discharge from the emergency department (ED) or hospital.

intervention.description: L-arginine will be dispensed intravenously (IV) in the standard dose of 100 mg/kg three times a day until discharge from the emergency department (ED) or hospital.
One loading dose of L-arginine will be dispensed intravenously (IV) at 200 mg/kg
Placebo of intravenous (IV) normal saline 1-2 ml/kg three times a day until discharge from the emergency department (ED) or hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Established diagnosis of sickle cell disease (SCD); all genotypes
- Pain requiring medical care in an acute care setting (such as the emergency department or ED, hospital ward, day hospital, clinic) not attributable to non-sickle cell causes, that is moderate-to-severe requiring parenteral opioids
Exclusion Criteria:
- Decision to discharge home from the acute care setting
- Hemoglobin less than 5 gm/dL or immediate need for red cell transfusion anticipated within next 12 hours
- Hepatic dysfunction of SGPT greater than 3 times the upper value
- Renal dysfunction of creatinine greater than 1.0
- Mental status or neurological changes
- Acute stroke or clinical concern for stroke
- Pregnancy
- Allergy to arginine
- Two (2) or more ED visits for VOE within the last 7 days prior to CURRENT ED visit
- Hospitalization within 14 days
- Previous randomization in this arginine RCT (patient consented and screen failed before receiving study drug or placebo remains eligible for future participation).
- Use of inhaled nitric oxide, sildenafil or arginine within the last month
- PICU admission from the emergency department
- Hypotension requiring treatment with clinical intervention

- Newly started on HU for <3 months
- Not an appropriate candidate in the investigator's judgment
- Patient refusal
